Course Objectives: <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; URL=noscript.html">METU | Course SyllabusCourse ObjectivesThis course provides an introduction to computational modeling in cognitive science, including computer simulation models of complex cognition, models within artificial intelligence, models based on neural mechanisms and networks, and formal and mathematical models in areas such as psychology, linguistics, and philosophy. The course also covers computational modeling of processes such as decision making, memory, learning, perception and basic motor actions within state of the art cognitive architectures as example application areas in cognitive science.
Course Learning Outcomes: <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; URL=noscript.html">METU | Course SyllabusCourse Learning OutcomesAt the end of the course students are expected to acquire basic computational and analytical skills for modeling specific cognitive processes as well as analyzing and evaluating them in an effort to further their understanding of human cognition.
Course Content: An introduction to computational modeling in cognitive science, including computer simulation
